ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Falísáyè pâ pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê la fó Yelúzálèm ńtó ńgyá Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie:
en: Then   Jesus was approached by Pharisees and scribes from Jerusalem, who asked,  # 15:1 Mk 3:22; Jn 1:19

ngiemboon: «Mélàʼakɔ́ ngàŋakwò jú té giŋe na tsẅé láʼ wɔ́ɔ? Pɔ́ gáa ḿpfɛ́ shúm té sɔg mbwó mɔ́b na ntí gie tsẅé láʼ ne ńzɛ́te?»
en: “Why do your disciples   break the tradition of the elders? For they don’t wash their hands when they eat.”  # 15:2 Lit eat bread = eat a meal,# 15:2 Lk 11:38; Gl 1:14; Col 2:8; Heb 11:2

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Á gʉa na pi, pi lɔgɔ tsẅé láʼ gí ńgwága Ssé mélàʼakɔ́?
en: He answered them, “Why do you break God’s commandment because of your tradition?

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gɔɔn ngie: “Gÿo mekùʼ tá gù pɔ́ má gù”, ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: “Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzoonte tá we kà má we wɔ́ɔ, mé zẅé ngàŋ.”
en: For God said:    Honor your father and your mother;   # 15:4 Ex 20:12; Dt 5:16,# 15:4 Ex 20:12; Dt 5:16; Eph 6:2 and, Whoever speaks evil of father or mother must be put to death.   # 15:4 Ex 21:17; Lv 20:9,# 15:4 Ex 21:17; Lv 20:9

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na pi, pi gɔɔn gí ngie: “Ngwɔ́ nyìŋ gɔɔn mbwó tá we kà má we wɔ́ɔ ngie, akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à lɔɔn ngwɔ́, á lɔg ńkẅéte yé cʉʼʉ́ ye Ssé.”
en: But you say, ‘Whoever tells his father or mother, “Whatever benefit you might have received from me is a gift committed to the temple,”

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ vɔg tà ńgɔɔn púʼu, mbà mé te gíŋe zɛ́te yé ngie: Tà ɔ̀ gÿǒ mekùʼ tá gù wɔ́? Púʼu, pi lɔgɔ tsẅé láʼ gí ńgwága shwóŋè Ssé.
en: he does not have to honor his father.’    In this way, you have nullified the word of God   # 15:6 Other mss read commandment because of your tradition.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pankwoŋmenÿɔ́g! Esáyà ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé, lɔ̌ɔn fɔ́ɔn ńgɔɔn páʼa éshwóŋo nò, páʼ à la gɔɔn na mà láʼ gẅi ngie e Ssé gɔ̌ɔn ngie:
en: Hypocrites! Isaiah prophesied correctly about you when he said:

ngiemboon: “Epʉ̀a pɛ̂ lɔgɔ pɔ́ ndàʼ ncwò wɔ́b ńguʼte wɔ́ɔn,
en: This people     honors me with their lips,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńguʼte wɔ́ɔn táʼ, anò té mǒ wɔ́, ńtí nue pɔ́ néŋe twó ńzíʼi pʉ̀a menò tɛʼ táʼ, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ menò pʉ̀a mesoŋ.”»
en: They worship me in vain,

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋo láʼ, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi téŋe tuŋó, ńcwoŋo ńjúʼu nò gie n gee ngɔ̌ɔn,
en: Summoning the crowd, he told them, “Listen and understand:

ngiemboon: ammó gie á fó ncwò nyìŋ ńkúu lepfòm yé, té gÿo á cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ wɔ́, agie á kẅɛɛ ncwò yé zɔ̌ gÿo á cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ.»
en: It’s not what goes into the mouth that defiles    a person, but what comes out of the mouth #— #this defiles a person.”   # 15:11 Ac 10:14–15; 1Tm 4:3

ngiemboon: Engàŋakwò Yěsô leen ńké sẅɛʼte nnɛ́ ńtó ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Tà ɔ̀ ne ńzsé ngie: Anò gie ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn la, á gegé pafalísáyè tɛʼ?»
en: Then the disciples came up and told him, “Do you know that the Pharisees took offense when they heard what you said? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Mé ge gÿo pú tsɔ́ʼɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ legǐ wɔ́ɔ gẅie Tá wɔ̀ɔn mie aa tÿǒ lepwó zɔ la te pye.
en: He replied, “Every plant that my heavenly Father didn’t plant will be uprooted.

ngiemboon: Pi nyé wɔ́b! Pɔ́ ée pafʉ̀menÿɔ́g pie é kíbe pwó petsɔ́. Afʉ̀menÿɔ́g lɔɔn ńkíbe pwó wetsɔ̌, mbà pɔ́b yé mépʉ́a ge cʉ́me tsɛ̀ɛ gem.»
en: Leave them alone! They are blind guides.    And if the blind guide the blind, both will fall into a pit.”   # 15:14 Mal 2:8; Mt 23:16,24; Lk 6:39

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: «Kyagte sagánò yɛ̂, éshwóŋo wég.»
en: Then Peter said, “Explain this parable to us.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Ńzsé ngie sí legye nyé ḿvɔ́g vɔ́g páʼ se petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwáa?
en: “Do you still lack understanding? ” he   asked.

ngiemboon: Ammó fó ncwò nyìŋ ńcʉa, ńkúu lepfòm yé, ḿbiŋ fó lepfòm yé ńkẅɛ, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kwɛ.
en: “Don’t you realize    that whatever goes into the mouth passes into the stomach and is eliminated?   # 15:17 Lit and goes out into the toilet

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ammó gie á fó ncwò nyìŋ ńkẅɛ, á fóo tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé, yɛ̌ zɔ̌ gÿo á cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ.
en: But what comes out of the mouth comes from the heart, and this defiles a person.

ngiemboon: Á nue menkwaŋá tepòŋ zɔɔn ńkẅɛ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m nyìŋ, mɛ̌ zɔ tsóte nyìŋ, á zẅé wetsɔ̌, á gÿo gÿɛ́, mbàŋa faʼ panzwě, panzwě faʼ mbàŋa, á jʉ, ńcÿɔ nò, á jʉʼ gie mé ŋaga mentsaŋ wó, ńtÿɔ́g sóon twó nyìŋ;
en: For from the heart come evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, sexual immoralities, thefts, false testimonies,    slander.   # 15:19 Ex 20:13–16; Gl 5:19–21; Jms 2:4

ngiemboon: sɔɔn lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ shúm sie é gÿo nyìŋ cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ. Táʼ, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjÿó shúm té sɔg mbwó na ntí gie mà láʼ wege ne ńzɛ́te, mba lejÿǒ púʼu á te gÿo à cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ wɔ́.»
en: These are the things that defile a person; but eating with unwashed hands does not defile a person.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo fóo jʉʼó ńgee na tsɔ́ pàga ngwòŋ, á shÿó tÿǒsoŋ Tîi pɔ́ Sindoŋ,
en: When Jesus left there,   he withdrew to the area of Tyre and Sidon.  # 15:21 Mt 11:21; Mk 7:24

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, atsɔ̌ manzwě Kanaan fó wó, ńtó, ńzye légaʼte, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavîd! E ssé tepòŋ pǔ ne ńgege míŋ wɔ̀ɔn wemanzwě tɛʼ.»
en: Just then a Canaanite woman from that region came and kept crying out,   “Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter is severely tormented by a demon.”  # 15:22 Gn 10:15,19; Jdg 1:30–33; Mt 4:24; 9:27

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Yěsô júʼ, ḿbú te pÿɛ. Engàŋakwò yé tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ésẅíŋte yé ngie: «Gÿo manzwě wɛ̂ gʉa, aa nzèm pege, ńgiŋe ḿbége jʉʼ.»
en: Jesus did not say a word to her. His disciples   approached him and urged him, “Send her away because she’s crying out after us.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «E Ssé la túmo wɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ndàʼ mbwó menjʉ̀njÿò mie é la pyé tsɛ̀ɛ ngẅɛ̀ ndá pa Ésàlayɛ.»
en: He replied, “I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, manzwě awɛ̌ tó, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, kẅéte wɔ́ɔn!»
en: But she came, knelt before him, and said, “Lord, help me! ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Á té poŋo lékẅé shúm léjÿó penkʉ́, ḿmaʼa mbwó púɔ ngwé wɔ́.»
en: He answered, “It isn’t right to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Andè, ɔ̀ gɔɔn shwóŋo nò táʼ, epúɔ ngwé ké ńdagte mesɔ̀ɔn shúm sie é fóo ndùm tápèle tá wɔb ńgwete ssé.»
en: “Yes, Lord,” she said, “yet even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńtsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Má wɔ̀ɔn! Ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m na mèŋ tɛʼ. Á poŋ ngie ammó gie ɔ̀ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn, à pumte! Yěsô gɔɔn púʼu, míŋ manzwě wa gwóon ńzeŋe pɔ́ kwàʼ fʉʼó.»
en: Then Jesus replied to her, “Woman, your faith is great. Let it be done for you as you want.” And from that moment   her daughter was healed.  # 15:28 Mt 9:22; 17:18; Jn 4:52–53

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo fó jʉʼó, ńgʉa né ngʉ̀ŋe letʉŋ sie ée Ngalílîa, ńkwɔ́ʼ tà ńkúu ndùm lekwɔʼɔ́, ńnéŋe ssé.
en: Moving on from there,   Jesus passed along the Sea of Galilee.  # 15:29 Mt 9:8; 18:8; Mk 9:43 He went up on a mountain and sat there,

ngiemboon: Menùɔ láʼ tó, ńgyá yé, ńgwaa tó, ńdɔg papwɔ̀ʼte mekwò, pâ pafʉ̀menÿɔ́g, pâ patàmbǎʼ, pâ menkǒon, mbɔɔ tsɔ́ megàŋa guɔ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńtó. Pɔ́ lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtóo mvfò Yěsô púʼu, á gÿo pɔ́ metsèm zeŋe.
en: and large crowds came to him, including the lame, the blind, the crippled, those unable to speak, and many others. They put them at his feet, and he healed them.

ngiemboon: Patàmbǎʼ gɔɔn nò, menkǒon zeŋe, papwɔ̀ʼte mekwò giŋ mboŋó, pafʉ̀menÿɔ́g gyá jʉʼ mboŋó. Aláʼ gyá ḿmɔɔn tɛʼ, ńguʼte Ssé pa Ésàlayɛ.
en: So the crowd was amazed when they saw those unable to speak talking, the crippled restored, the lame walking, and the blind seeing,   and they gave glory to the God of Israel.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋ ngàŋakwò yé, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Mezìŋe láʼ yɔɔn pǔ ńkúu wɔ́ɔn tɛʼ, mélàʼmie ée fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ sétá, páʼ pɔ́ ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ, ńké te nyé ńgẅiin tsɔ́ mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pfɛ́ wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn nyé wɔ́b pɔ́ gʉa nzyè, mbà pɔ́ té gẅiin metʉ̀ lélɔg ńgʉa tà ńkú wɔ́.»
en: Jesus called his disciples and said,   “I have compassion on the crowd, because they’ve already stayed with me three days and have nothing to eat. I don’t want to send them away hungry, otherwise they might collapse on the way.”

ngiemboon: Engàŋakwò yé gɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: «Ngwɔ́ peg lɔg mbelég nzɔ̌, á kwòŋotsẅɛ wɔɔn, ńdɔg ńjÿɔ́g nzẅìŋ láʼ yɔɔn tà pɔ́ zẅɛ́?»
en: The disciples said to him, “Where could we get enough bread in this desolate place   to feed such a crowd? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: «Pi gẅiin mbelég jʉʼɛ mbuʼú shÿɔ́ʼɔ? Pɔ́ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: Peg gẅiin mbelég mbuʼú sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ńgíŋe ńgÿo mbɔ́ ntáʼ membaŋ ssó.»
en: “How many loaves do you have? ” Jesus asked them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsẅi ngie aláʼ néŋte ssé.
en: After commanding the crowd to sit down on the ground,

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńkẅé mbelég ŋwɛ́ mbuʼú sɔɔnmbʉ́a lê messó ma, ńná ndǎg mbwó Ssé, ḿbwɔ́ʼte ńnáa mbwó ngàŋakwò yé, pɔ́ gaba mbwó láʼ.
en: he took the seven loaves and the fish, gave thanks, broke them, and gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.

ngiemboon: Mânyìŋ ntsèm pú ḿpfɛ́ tà ńzẅɛ́, mé piŋ ńcúʼte pfwɔ̀ʼ, á lúe metúŋ sɔɔnmbʉ́a.
en: They all ate and were satisfied. They collected the leftover pieces #— #seven large baskets full.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é la pfɛ́ɛ mmó laa mbàŋa ntsáʼ lekùɔ, té sáŋ penkʉ́ lâ panzwě.
en: Now there were four thousand men who had eaten, besides women and children.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsẅi, aláʼ gʉa. Á kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ, ńgʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Magandaŋ.
en: After dismissing the crowds, he got into the boat and went to the region of Magadan.  ,# 15:39 Mk 3:9; 8:10
